documents.document: @ZakEgholm Nightmare. It's a bit late notice to find some cover now!
Asier Garitano says that as David Timor's out with two broken fingers, new boy Erik Morán can "lend a hand". #dark https://t.co/uNxK2Ee68C
@DanykarvajaI If they continue like this, 2 or 3 of them could well be on their way soon enough. At least Espanyol will get remunerated well
Deportivo La Coruña vs Real Betis has been rescheduled for January 1st 2099. Hopefully Joaquín will be fully fit by… https://t.co/VDANvCukXG
Marc Navarro (21), Aarón Martín (19), Oscar Melendo (19), Marc Roca (20) all impressive this season, all tied down to long-term contracts.
Under Quique Sánchez Flores, Espanyol's academy talents are flourishing as they build for a bright future #RCDE https://t.co/fEn7P2BhBE
@JackRathborn Arrival of Kakuta may have pushed him further down the pecking order. A lot of raw potential but not what Depor need this year
@JackRathborn Not a great deal, a weak Depor side but he's not nailed down a place. Decision-making poor. Was left out of tonight's squad
The rain in Spain falls mostly on the Riazor. A shame to see Depor vs Betis suspended this evening. ☔️ https://t.co/Qde5cXytoz
Deal of the day by #Osasuna. For starters, with Sirigu in goal, they would've beaten Malaga at the weekend. https://t.co/dNllMQnzW0
@Nr32OnTheBack @PhilHayYEP He did start one La Liga game in 15/16 (home to Levante) but was replaced at half-time. Has improved since then.
@Nr32OnTheBack @PhilHayYEP our Segunda analyst @FRfutbolJuanMa might be able to offer an opinion, having watched him excel at Lugo this year
@Nr32OnTheBack @PhilHayYEP As he's played so little for Villarreal I've only seen him play a couple of times in the last 18 months but (1/2)
Regardless of his reputation in Manchester, it's clear what the fans think of him over here #MangalaQuedate https://t.co/eQAF3ftiK8
#Mangala looking forward after his error & tonight's defeat. "A winner is simply someone who does not give up when… https://t.co/R06wXhili4
Looking forward to Neyver using this. https://t.co/XMIhylMWEG
@emctear agreed, another year in this team and he could really explode. Once he learns to control his pace & aggression he'll be unstoppable
@emctear A "young Bale" indeed, looked equally adept at left-wing earlier in the season. Just needs a bit of maturity in terms of discipline
@FRcalcioRob #OptaSmithers
A towering header on the stroke of half-time - Espanyol 2-1 Sevilla. Real Madrid are having a splendid day & they haven't even played yet.
Marc Navarro is a goal machine! The young right-back, only starting due to Victor Sanchez's injury, scores his 2nd goal in 2 senior apps!
Game back on! Jovetic with the tap-in after an incisive move. Will be interesting to see which way the pendulum swings next #EspanyolSevilla
@LaLigaGav Let's hope so, for the sake of this title race.
Pareja with the slightest contact on Piatti, penalty & red card in the 2nd minute, JA Reyes converts against his former club. #drama
We're about ready for the final whistle here at Cornellà-El Prat. Espanyol a goal up and a man up after 4 minutes. #EspanyolSevilla
Filthy finish from Suarez in the 93rd min for 2-1, but ref had already blown for handball. Barca only deserved a point today. Betis v good.
Barcelona are playing their annual Sunday lunchtime game vs Real Betis, who can't even get a sociable kickoff time when playing the big boys
HT #Alavés 0-0 #AtléticoMadrid - Hard to believe Pellegrino's side aren't ahead at the break. The better side by miles.
Cholo turning up at Mendizorrotza like he means business (via @Alaves) https://t.co/XaztIBHrHe
@spbetting1 Charles went down quite easily for me. Seen them given (excuse the cliché) but think the referee made a good call.
FT #Osasuna 1-1 #Malaga. In many ways that was inevitable. Osasuna briefly up to 19th, but still 8pts from safety. https://t.co/ZtnqF5Fgsg
Malaga now taking the ascendancy in the final 10 minutes. A draw no good for either team really. Something's got to give.
It's 1-1! Osasuna's lead didn't last five minutes & it's madness by Mario. Comes for a long throw but doesn't get there; Camacho nods in.
Instant contribution by De Las Cuevas, brought on not 10 seconds earlier. Played a delightful cross towards Kenan.
HUGE goal at El Sadar. Goran Causic sidefoots Osasuna ahead after a composed lay-off by Kenan Kodro. 1-0 & set to move off the bottom.
Unlikely to ever happen, but a centre-back pairing of Demichelis & Weligton would be fun. 73 years of South American grit between them.
I say "new", whilst also acknowledging that Demichelis is 36 years old.
Malaga's new central defensive axis is encouraging. Looking far more secure with Luis Hernández/Demichelis than with Villanueva/Llorente.
Slightly more to it than that, as Malaga have dominated the opening 40 minutes and Michael Santos saw a tame penalty saved by Mario.
Osasuna, who haven't won at home all season, are hosting Malaga, who haven't won away all season, in the Friday #LaLiga game. Currently 0-0.
From Saito to Upamecano: find out who made the @FootballRadar team of 2016! https://t.co/JdShWRJlvz
Celta vs Alavés is a superb outcome in the CdR semis. Both having such a fantastic season that a final is richly deserved for one of them.
Love this Celta Vigo side. Lovely placed-finish by Daniel Wass, & a nice contribution from Jozabed. Goodnight @realmadrid #CopaDelRey
@JackRathborn Danilo's had some discomfort this week, but regardless he's been bang average for a long while now. Casemiro just not a CB
@JackRathborn Defence looks confused. Absences of Varane, Pepe, Carvajal & Marcelo just so obvious, Danilo getting caught high up the pitch
@JackRathborn Started well but been sixes & sevens at the back in the last 10 minutes. Just lucky Aspas is having a rare wasteful game
@JackRathborn I've been surprised with how well he's slotted in here, much more of the former than the latter, couple goals & so versatile
Aleksandar Pantić a surprise omission for @Alaves tonight. The Serbian centre-back could be close to joining Bursaspor. #FRtransfer
@GaffneyVLC does anyone actually think that
By contrast, after Juanmi's winner La Real join 4th-placed Atlético Madrid on 35 points. Just rewards for a superb first half of the season.
FT #RealSociedad 1-0 #Celta. Berizzo's mass rotation gamble may pay off if they make the semis on Wednesday, but they fell short tonight.
Last roll of the dice for Berizzo and dat guy Iago Aspas is on for the final '10, replacing Pape Cheik Diop. All set for a grandstand finish
Guidetti is now on replacing Señé, as it seems the coach is determined to give Aspas the evening off, at the possible expense of the result.
Berizzo brought Radoja on to try to shore up the midfield after Jozabed had tired, but the team desperately lacked an outlet like Bongonda.
Juanmi puts Real Sociedad ahead after 71 minutes! Richly deserved and completely unsurprising after an extended spell of pressure.
Carlos Vela, clean through after a pass from Canales, sees his shot saved by the trailing leg of Sergio Álvarez. Still 0-0, La Real on top.
Pione Sisto, who's been very lively, nearly puts Celta ahead. They've settled well after a bright start from the hosts. #RealSociedadCelta
@LaLigaGav Indeed we do. Berizzo called that match "life or death" but still feels his XI here is "strong & competitive" #NotSureAboutThat
Eusébio Sacristán will hope his side have the game wrapped up by then. Hopefully the game can live up to today's very high standard! #LaLiga
Celta will want to keep it tight & nick a goal or at least contain La Real until the final half hour when Berizzo can throw on the big guns.
About to kick-off in Anoeta - two top teams competing for the European places. Celta, as expected, have heavily rotated. #RealSociedadCelta
@Paul_Morrissey agreed- spoilt for options, defending obviously an issue at times but again showed today they can score from any situation
Feel for Osasuna. Took the game to Sevilla & deserved better. Léon said "we'll die fighting" & they're certainly fighting. It finishes 3-4.
Imagine having the depth to bring on Correa, Kranevitter & Sarabia. Vietto & Kiyotake also on bench. Sampaoli's Sevilla keep on truckin'...
Osasuna having the luck of a team at the bottom. Superior to Sevilla, as they were superior to Granada last week, but it's 1-1 at HT.
Osasuna need León to maintain scoring form if they're to have any chance of survival. Clearly their best attacker but so wasteful of late.
At El Sadar the cat is amongst the pigeons...or should I say, the León - as Sergio fires table proppers Osasuna 1-0 up vs 2nd-placed Sevilla
FT #Villarreal 0-2 #Valencia. Valencia have a second victory in a row and a first clean sheet since 20.04.16 (4-0 vs Eibar) #TheVoroEffect!
The people have spoken in their masses, and the clear winner with 66.6% of the vote is Spiros Vondas.
@simonhfootball His shoot-on-sight/ cross-on-sight philosophy is absolutely infuriating.
@LaLigaGav @Millar_Colin Aye that would be magic. Imagine the furore if he went there. Press would have a field day!
@LaLigaGav @Millar_Colin Other than Valencia I haven't seen much. Will still cost around 2-3 million, I'd've thought, which rules out a lot
@Millar_Colin Absolutely- Orellana would be an incredible addition of quality to the attack, & at a snip. I imagine Rubén would be thrilled!
@DanielFMPro agreed, shame to see such talented players stagnating - in Espinoza's case he's been a victim of Alaves being very competitive
@DanielFMPro Villarreal will likely loan Cristian Espinoza elsewhere now. Alaves will return him to free a non-EU place for Romero, I think
This doesn't look good - hopefully nothing serious. 35-year old Joaquín just returned from an injury at the weekend. https://t.co/JXn780rVpW
Not bad for a left-back...@theo3_theo was on 🔥 for Alavés yesterday. https://t.co/caASYyVGkl
@FRvoetbalJonc Never got a chance at Alavés, said team was "too defensive" for his attack-focused, possession-based style. #Miniesta
@davidjaca He was superb at Getafe last season & nearly carried them to safety. No surprise to see him excelling at a much better side.
Granada have the goal their second half pressure has merited, Kravets bundling home. 1-1 with 20 mins left. A point no good for either side.
Osasuna lead in Los Cármenes! Super strike from Oriol Riera puts them 0-1 ahead after a bright start. Granada fans airing their displeasure.
Theo didn't seem too happy about that at all. He and Camarasa exchange heated words as they trudge off. A valiant effort from the away side.
Theo & Manu Garcia were standing over it; ultimately the young left-back deferred to the club captain who fired straight at the wall. 1-0 FT
Free-kick for Alavés from inside the D, in the 94th minute! Hold onto your hats...
Celta have done it! Radoja with a composed finish after Llorente fluffed a rapid Alavés break. Very cool finish from the Serbian. 1-0!
Still goalless with 4 minutes + stoppage remaining. Alavés dangerous on the counter but Mallo nearly scored with a cross off the post.
Alavés doing a job on a tired Celta team. If anything, going down to 10 men has helped them - they've become more compact to break down.
Four yellow cards in as many minutes for Valencia (Soler, Parejo, Gaya, Munir). Need to be careful...
Nani, in his first start since the 3-1 win vs Leganes in November, is making all the difference to Valencia's attacking transitions.
For QSF & Espanyol, the slide is in danger of continuing. From unbeaten in 11 games (all comps) to winless in three & counting. V poor here.
HT #Valencia 1-0 #Espanyol. A blistering start for Voro's side, followed by a controlled half an hour protecting their lead. So far, so good
Superb interchanges of passing on the edge of the Espanyol box, confidently walking the ball past one of the meanest defences in the league.
GOOOOOOL! Montoya scores his 2nd in as many games after Nani slips him in - haven't seen Valencia play flowing football like that all year!
Diego Lopez was a major doubt for today, and so far looks like he could have been rushed back too soon. Uncharacteristically nervy start.
Valencia well on top in the opening minutes - Soler has a shot cleared off the line after a spell of pressure. Good to see him start again.
Surely it's time Valencia won a game? The 17th-placed strugglers host Espanyol in the early kick-off. Diego Lopez back after injury. #LaLiga
@DanielFMPro True. Uninspiring subs all round. Garitano withdrawing Andone was tragic - could've taken anyone else off.
@DanielFMPro pretty anaemic stuff. Villarreal came for the goalless draw & got it. Questionable lack of ambition for a top-4 chasing side.
Never in doubt. @Aubameyang7 scores the first goal of #CAN2017. @FRfussballNick wrote about him in our magazine: https://t.co/GqttG1ztCE
Valencia concede in stoppage time again! Irrelevant, but nevertheless a sublime free-kick by Pione Sisto to give Celta the win on the night.
